meanings.definition: Using more words than necessary to convey meaning.
meanings.sent1: Her pleonastic speech made it hard to understand her point.
meanings.sent2: The pleonastic report was filled with unnecessary details.
meanings.sent3: His pleonastic storytelling always put his friends to sleep.
meanings.sent4: The pleonastic advertisement repeated the same information over and over.
meanings.sent5: The pleonastic instructions confused the students even more.

meanings.definition: Characterized by redundancy or unnecessary repetition.
meanings.sent1: The pleonastic movie kept showing the same scenes repeatedly.
meanings.sent2: Her pleonastic writing style made the article longer than needed.
meanings.sent3: The pleonastic clock in the waiting room ticked loudly every second.
meanings.sent4: The pleonastic song played on the radio for the tenth time that day.
meanings.sent5: The pleonastic conversation looped back to the same topics over and over.
